alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 12:28PM EST until further notice by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River at Vincennes. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River at Riverton, Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site, Montezuma, and Mount Carmel. East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Hazleton and Petersburg. .Ongoing and renewed flooding will continue on the White, East Fork White, and Wabash Rivers. River flood stages are expected to rise again in the next few days as additional rainfall is expected tonight and tomorrow. Flooding on the lower portions of the Wabash and White rivers is currently forecast to last through much of the week, but could be extended based on expected rainfall over the next few days. Additional portions of these and other waterways not currently in flood may return to flood conditions early this week based on this expected rainfall. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Hazleton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Most of the low bottomlands flood. Flooding begins in higher bottomlands. High water affects any residents in Pottsville river cabins. Pottsville Road...North C Street on river side of railroad tracks and Catt Street near U.S. Highway 41 are flooded. Water is near or starting on Giro Road in the vicinity of submerged Pottsville Road. Oil stripped fields flood. Flood gates must be installed at Hazleton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.0 feet Monday, March 14. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1130 PM CST /1230 AM EST/.
